Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Laxative \Lax"a*tive\, a. [L. laxativus mitigating, assuaging: cf. F. laxatif. See {Lax}, a.] 1. Having a tendency to loosen or relax. --Milton. [1913 Webster]
2. (Med.) Having the effect of loosening or opening the intestines, and relieving from constipation; -- opposed to {astringent}. -- n. (Med.) A laxative medicine. See the Note under {Cathartic}. [1913 Webster]
laxative adj : stimulating evacuation of feces [ant: {costive}] n : a mild cathartic
